If you attended the Langley sensei karate seminar in 2013 you know that you will not want to miss his return visit to Canada for this two day intensive karate seminar. Learn from a master, one of only 5 westerners to graduate the intensive  JKS Instructors Course. Langley sensei will be instructing childrens and adult seminars on Friday and Saturday.

Advance registration is recommended, take advantage of our packaged All Session pricing. Please purchase tickets in advance and print out your tickets to bring to the event.

Scott Langley 6th Dan

Scott is one of the youngest people ever to win the World Championships and has over 25 years experience practicing and teaching karate.

Scott spent 5 years studying at the Japan Karate Shotorenmei World Headquarters in Tokyo and then returned to Ireland with a mandate to build the JKS in the UK & Ireland.

“Scott Langley is one of the few instructors to have learnt karate in Japan from the source. He teaches the true art of karate. In Europe this is very rare and should be taken advantage of!” Yutaka Koike 5th Dan – All Japan Champion

224682567720616.description:
Nouvelle coproduction entre le 7(7) café et Club Bizarre. Cette fois nous avons le plaisir de recevoir les canadiens de Jokers of the Scene au courant de leur tournée européenne. 
Le rendez-vous est donc pris le Jeudi 3 Avril à partir de 22h, warm up par Club Bizarre, entrée libre bien entendu! 

JOKERS OF THE SCENE (NEW KANADA/THRONE OF BLOOD) :

Toronto duo JOKERS OF THE SCENE have ranked among the brightest lights in Canada’s dance music renaissance, with a string of releases on Fool’s Gold Records and a deep remix catalogue.
For the latest JOTS releases and possibly the most expansive yet , they recruited remixers Daniel Avery, Mickey Moonlight, Psycatron, Hrdvsion and more creating a soundtrack perfect for home listening and strobe-lit warehouses alike.
Late 2012 also saw the birth and debut EP of their collaborative alias Bohemian Groove on Throne Of Blood Records. They are also working on original JOTS material for the New York based label this year.

https://www.facebook.com/JokersoftheScene
http://soundcloud.com/jokers-of-the-scene


CLUB BIZARRE (DAYS OF BEING WILD/ASTROLAB) : 

Créé en Novembre 2010, le Club Bizarre de Binda et Sam Berdah s'est fait petit à petit une place dans la scène électronique. Après un premier EP sorti sur le label anglais Days Of Being Wild et remixé par Chloé, quelques remixes pour Clouded Vision et Startalk Int. notamment, le duo prépare la sortie de deux nouveaux EPs avant l'été, ainsi qu'un morceau sur la prochaine compilation Clouded Vision Experiment et plusieurs remixes. Entre quelques dates à Berlin, Londres, Madrid et Tel-Aviv, Club Bizarre sera aux commandes du 7(7) pour ouvrir la soirée. Un printemps chargé donc…

http://www.facebook.com/leclubbizarre
http://www.soundcloud.com/club-bizarre


ARTWORK : HELLOGZA
224682567720616.name: Jokers Of The Scene (New Kanada/Throne Of Blood - Toronto), Club Bizarre @ 7(7) Café

TORONTO - Convocado por la Embajada del Uruguay en Canadá y el Consulado General en Toronto se realizará un encuentro y diálogo abierto de la comunidad con el Ministro de Relaciones Exteriores de Uruguay, Dr. Luis Almagro. De la organización de este encuentro participan también el Club Uruguay Toronto, Comité de Solidaridad Mano con Mano, Consejo Consultivo Toronto y Grupo Solidario Ibiray-Toronto, 
 
La convocatoria pretende acercar a la comunidad en una conversación amena en la que los participantes podrán hacer preguntas y presentar inquietudes sobre el Uruguay, la diáspora, o cualquier tema de interés.

El encuentro tendrá lugar el miércoles 9 de abril a las 19:30 horas en el Toronto Plaza Hotel, 1677 Wilson Av. (frente a Sheridan mall). Las puertas del salón se abrirán al público a partir de las 19:00hrs dando inicio al acto a las 19:30. 

Admisión libre

225826027578663.description:
Thank you to everyone who came out to Empty The Tanks 2013! 

Please save the date May 24, 2014 

Just in the planning stages - More info to follow soon

Facts...
Approximately 17 dolphin family members are killed for every one dolphin sold (for ~$200,000) to Seaworld, Marineland and all the other Marine Abusement Parks that hold cetaceans captive for our entertainment. 

If there is no demand, there will be no Slaughter.
For the Dolphin Slaughter to end, people actually have to do Nothing! They just have to NOT buy a ticket! 

Dolphins & Whales

•	There are currently 42 orcas being held captive worldwide.

•	At least 136 wild orcas have been taken into captivity from the wild since 1961. 

•	123 of these (or 90.4%) orcas are now dead.

•	Orcas & Dolphins are self aware and have language. 

•	Dolphin calves call their mothers ‘by name’. Dolphin friends call each other by name.

•	Dolphins are altruistic. They will not leave a family member in distress and have often rescued humans and other predator species

•	Scientists say that due to their high intelligence and complex social structure, dolphins should be designated as non-human persons with rights 

•	In the wild, Orcas live as long or longer than humans
              In captivity, their lives are cut toless than half that.

•	Dolphins live 25-50 years in the wild, but only average 5 yrs. in captivity

•	Dolphin sons never leave their mother’s side their entire lives
•	Orca offspring never leave their mothers side their entire lives.  

•	Approximately 1,000 Dolphins are inhumanely slaughtered in Taiji every year.

•	Of those, 250 are selected for captivity. The rest will be butchered for their meat which is extremely toxic with mercury.

•	Captive Dolphins sell for $150,000 or more to Seaquariums making this at least a $40 million per year business for Taiji. 

•	53% of captured dolphins will die within 3 months of confinement.


•	Food is withheld from Orcas & Dolphins to ensure they perform

•	Many are on medications their whole lives

•	Orcas & Dolphins are forced to inbreed. Mothers often reject captive born babies bred from close relatives.
•	Wild Orcas swim up to 100 miles/day
•	Wild dolphins swim up to 40 miles/day

It would take 5,000 endless circles per day to swim that far in a tank


From September 1st, 2012  -  Feb. 25, 2013:

	1,486 dolphins were driven into the cove in Taiji, Japan. 

o	899 were killed
o	247 were live-capture.

o	340  survivors were released

o	Dolphin meat sold as food is highly toxic with mercury

	
Dolphins struggle in pain and terror while they are bludgeoned, stabbed, suffocated and sliced open, still alive.  It is NOT a quick death. Family members stuggle to rescue their loved ones until it’s their turn.  
Those selected for captivity swim in their family's blood watching the horror. 
Still in shock, captive dolphins are trained by starvation to do tricks for food. 

Captive dolphins who would swim 40 miles per day in the wild, hunting fresh fish are confined to a tiny chlorinated pool & fed dead fish, destined to entertain or ‘swim with’ humans to survive, never seeing their pod again.  
Dolphin Sonar, a useful tool in the wild, disorients them as it bounces off the concrete pool walls. It’s like living in a hall of mirrors.

They become neurotic and depressed and agressively frustrated.

3 trainers have been killed by Orcas so far and numerous attacks have been recorded.

Dolphins in captivity die from capture shock, pneumonia, intestinal disease, ulcers, chlorine poisoning, and other stress-related illnesses. To the captive dolphin industry, these facts are accepted as routine operating expenses.

The only way to learn about dolphin habits is in the wild. They don't have any natural habits in captivity.

Everytime someone buys a ticket to a marine abusement park, they support the slaughter of these family-oriented, sentient beings.


The only way to close their doors for good is to get the general public to stop buying tickets. We need your voice, your posters, and your dedication to seeing an end to the captivity industry.

 EMPTY THE TANKS!

**Please only RSVP to the events you are going to attend and contact the email below if you are interested in holding a Empty the Tanks protest in your town!!!! Let's make this huge!


The main page with links to each city :  https://www.facebook.com/events/589482841111412/?fref=ts

226956234167975.description:
GOT WHAT IT TAKES TO WIN A GAME ABOUT TORONTO?
You Could Be the Champ of TradeCity!

On April 1st 2014, TradeCity: Toronto beta will launch a live reality augmented game.  Visit tradecitygame.com for details on how to register for your chance to be the Champ of TradeCity.

TradeCity: Toronto beta is a live reality game that takes place from April 1st to 12th 2014, throughout Metro Toronto. TradeCity is an experimental art project by Toronto-based artist Golboo Amani.  Amani has partnered up with various co-operative communities to design an exciting game that is both fun and challenging!

TradeCity:Toronto is an adventure based game that explores Toronto by asking Players to compete in site-specific as well as virtual challenges. There are dozens of chances to win prizes by demonstrating your gaming skills!  

To play you must register in person on April 1, 2014 from 7pm to 9pm at TradeCity: Toronto beta Headquarters, University of Toronto Art Centre, 15 King's College Circle. Players can register as a team or as individual players. You must be 18 years or older to play. Registration is FREE! For more information visit tradecitygame.com.



Golboo Amani is an interdisciplinary artist who creates projects that focus on concepts of community that blur the boundaries between art and life. Amani's work often deals with alternative and sustainable forms of “currency” and exchange.  Past projects have included developing sites for generous skill sharing and empowered acts of reclamation. Amani is best known for her public performance work 'The School of Bartered Knowledge' where she offers 'fair-trade' exchanges of knowledge with passersby. 

“Amani's social interface gently pushes aside the anonymity of the internet in favour of a refreshingly direct and open-ended exchange of information.” DAVID JAGER Now Magazine

This year the artist has taken on a large scale project that brings together various communities, co-operative spaces and local residents in a fun and adventurous way.
226956234167975.name: TRADECITY: TORONTO beta - !PLAYER REGISTRATION DAY!

248598888645541.description:
Update: Here's the Civic Champions that we've announced so far that will be there: Evergreen, CivicAction, City Youth Council of Toronto, Mayoral Candidates John Tory, Robb Johannes and Morgan Baskin, Groundforce Digital, Jane's Walk, Women in Toronto Politics, UforChange, NoJetsTO, TTC Riders, RaBIT, Cycle Toronto, The City of Toronto, Pathways to Education - Regent Park, Coalition of Youth Councils, Park People, Hivewire, GenSqueeze, Chrystia Freeland Liberal MPP, RiseEdutainment, 100 in 1 Day, Daniels Spectrum, Youth Empowering Parents, Regent Park Focus, Better Budget TO, Open Streets, Toronto Seed Library, Faith in Regent Park, Daniels’ Learning Centre, Shape My City, Green Ribbon, Imagine Cities, Youth Health Action Network , Regent Park Food Partnership Committee and Greenthumbs. 

----

On April 10th, we're going to host a civic engagement fair - imagine grassroots community meets the job fair model - so that we can all learn about how to get involved in our city from civic leaders/advocacy groups/other citizens/etc. 

It's called Turnout Toronto! 

This will be our second TT, the first one was held at CSI Annex in January and was attended by +500 folks and +50 plus civic champions for them to meet, learn from and support. 

The purpose of Turnout Toronto is to educate on the opportunities to get involved (e.g. working on a political campaign, volunteer with elections Toronto, become a member of Better Budget TO, etc), which hopefully leads to things like higher voter turnout, civic participation and love for TO. We can debate five ways to Sunday on what the city needs but we'd all agree that you can never have enough love. 

If you've felt the urge to take action, especially leading up to the fall civic elections, consider this a starting point to learn about the options on what type of action you can take. 

And if you'd like to share your project with the crowd to rally support and inspire, drop one of the event organizers a line and we'll take it from there.

248598888645541.name: Turnout Toronto: Regent Park

Momentum Dance Toronto presents: 

OFF CANVAS
 ~ art.  inspired. ~

APRIL 23 - 26, 2014

LOCATION: Winchester Street Theatre
80 Winchester Street, Toronto

Can you imagine our world without the arts?  Indeed, art plays a vital role in making our lives infinitely rich.  No matter the art form, artistic expression is a window into the soul of another and can be the voice of human experience.  In this year's fourth annual production, Momentum Dance Toronto challenged choreographers to seek inspiration from some of the world's most accomplished visual artists, and to explore what happens with space and movement when in relation to paint on a canvas.  We hope to demonstrate how varied interpretations of art can highlight and inspire the individual artist within us all.

Momentum Dance Toronto invites you to attend one of our five shows - to sit back, relax and be inspired by ART and its many canvases.

255569561291874.description:
"Alternatingly delicate and brutal." 
-The Hollywood Reporter 

"A moving and unflinching character study"
-CriterionCast

"What a little gem of a film It's Only Make Believe is."
-Letterboxd.com

After serving 10 years in prison for murder, Jenny returns to society. She dreams of living a quiet life and of resuming her responsibilities as a mother, but soon dark shadows from the past start to appear. "It's Only Make Believe" is the story of a murder that never should have happened, of friends that never should have been trusted, and a debt that keeps on increasing for every down payment. Although Jenny has lost everything, she still has everything to win: her daughter. "It's Only Make Believe" is an exciting thriller and a heartfelt drama that marks a return to energetic and passionate filmmaking for Norwegian maverick director Arild Østin Ommundsen.

Opens June 6th at Toronto's Carlton and Kingsway Cinemas.

http://www.eventyrlandfilmen.no/

Trailer:  http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ySjFgd94NS0

257799344380308.description:
The University of Toronto Refugee Alliance invites you to our annual charity fundraiser! (For tickets visit http://www.utrafundraiser.eventbee.com)

Please join us for dinner, music, art, and drinks on March 19 as we strive to do our bit for the plight facing refugees around the world. All proceeds from the event will be directed to the Syrian refugee crisis, through the Red Crescent (Red Cross), as well as to the Scarborough Community Volunteer Clinic, in keeping with our tradition of contributing locally.

This is a great opportunity to network with like-minded individuals to discuss and raise awareness about the innumerable problems encountered, both while seeking refuge and in host countries, by increasing refugee populations. More importantly, the perfect opportunity for all of us to help make a difference for the lives of refugees. We hope to see you there!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2Xiaq5dilRg


Student tickets: $30
General tickets: $40
Tickets can be purchased from:
http://www.utrafundraiser.eventbee.com

If you are not able to attend this event but still want to contribute, you can make a donation at the link above as well.


Guest Speakers:

Rima Kamal has been a delegate with the International Committee of the Red Cross for over 7 years. Her ICRC missions included Syria, Iraq, Jerusalem and Jordan.  During this time, she was a protection delegate working to uphold the rights of detainees and document violations of International Humanitarian Law. More recently, she was ICRC's spokesperson and head of its communication department in Syria. Previously, she worked as a consular officer for the Swedish Ministry of Foreign Affairs (2004-2006) in Jerusalem and Los Angeles. She holds an M.A. in Political Science from the University of Gothenburg in Sweden.

Dr. Paul Caulford is the Medical Director of the Scarborough Community Volunteer Clinic for medically uninsured immigrants and refugees. He is the Lead Physician and President of the Scarborough Academic Family Health Team in Toronto and is also an Assistant Professor in the Department of Family and Community Medicine at the University of Toronto. 
Read more about his work and findings here:
http://www.cfp.ca/content/58/7/725.full#corresp-1
http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3681469/


Where the money is going:

1. In 2011, a civil war broke out in Syria. Since then, there have been approximately 2.5 million Syrian refugees. The UN estimates that there will be more than 5 million Syrian refugees by the end of 2014. Red Crescent works to build secure refugee camps for the Syrian refugees inside and out of the country's borders. Essential needs, such as shelter and field hospitals, are provided for the refugees through Red Crescent.

2. In Canada, thousands of refugees and immigrants arrive and are denied basic and urgent healthcare. After being exposed to and escaping war and oppression, thousands of Canada's newcomers find themselves once again facing hurdles- within our healthcare system. Scarborough Community Volunteer Clinic provides free primary healthcare for medically uninsured refugees and immigrants in Canada.
257799344380308.name: University of Toronto Refugee Alliance Fundraiser

259126587600824.description:
We are pleased to invite you to the Toronto premiere of Ashid Bahl's film "For the Love of Children", winner of BEST PICTURE and BEST FEATURE DOCUMENTARY at the Monaco International Film Festival in December of 2013.
 
7:00-8:00 PM: Meet & Greet 
8:00 PM SHARP: FILM STARTS
9:00 PM: Q & A with Director Ashid Bahl, Raffle draw!

INBOX ME TO RESERVE TICKETS- Admission is $30.00.
All proceeds of this special screening benefit the victims of Typhoon Haiyan in the Philippines.
 
SYNOPSIS:
The film follows the journey of the courageous Ashid Bahl, considered by many to be a Saint and Hero, as he overcomes numerous challenges building schools, orphanages, creating sustainable living conditions for communities and delivering much needed care to children all over the world, while inspiring others to do the same by his example of selfess service, love and compassion.

About For the Love of Children Society:
This year marks the 33rd anniversary of Ashid Bahl’s aid work with For the Love of Children Society, providing millions of dollars of aid in supplies, support and man power to build stable orphanages and schools, and deliver medicine and healing methods that would otherwise be unavailable.
Bahl and his team have been at the front line of over a dozen torn and devastated countries including Lebanon, Sudan, Afghanistan, Haiti, Colombia, Peru, Sri Lanka and Japan. Run entirely by volunteers and charitable donations, the organization has built 76 schools and touched the lives of over 100,000 children to date.
Ashid and the Society have received recognition and praise from community leaders including the Prime Minister of Canada Stephen Harper, His Holiness the 14th Dalai Lama, Her Majesty Queen of Elizabeth II and humanitarian Angelina Jolie.

We thank-you for your support behind this amazing cause and look forward to seeing you at the Premiere!

"Life is not about us; life is about making it happen for someone else who is less fortunate. In that lies the true significance of living."
- Ashid Bahl, Director
259126587600824.name: "For the Love of Children" Toronto Film Premiere

A világ sok országában szerepelt és több mint egy tucat sikeres koncert turnén vett részt Észak Amerikában. Több világhírű zenekar vendégművésze volt az USAban, mint pl. a Philadelphia Orchestra, Portland Symphony, New World Symphony, Brooklyn Philharmonic és más zenekarok. Habár Kálmán a Magyar népzenén nevelkedett,  egyformán otthon van a balkán népzenében és a jazz világában, valamint a klezmer zenében. A mostani turnén, kitünő zenészbarátaival, világzenét játszik, ami a jazz és a népzene fúziója – állandó izgalmas, friss, újstílusú improvizáció.
 
 Március 25, kedd este 7 óra/ March 25, Tuesday 7pm

(Coxwell-Danforth  •  2 percnyire a Coxwell metró megállótól)

Central European World Music
Kálmán Balogh Cimbalom Trio from Hungary
Kálmán Balogh is one of the foremost Hungarian cimbalom players, descending from a famous dynasty of Hungarian Gypsy musicians. His virtuosity is matched only by his understanding and respect of his heritage. A graduate of Ferenc Liszt Academy of Music of Budapest, he has completed many successful tours throughout the world with various ensembles, including well over a dozen tours in North America. The cimbalom, a sort of oversized hammer dulcimer played with mallets like a vibraphone, possesses piano like percussive abilities to drive a band rhythmically or take the melodic lead. In Kálmán Balogh's expert hands, the cimbalom can do both simultaneously. His mastery of this unique and rare Hungarian folk instrument has mesmerized audiences.
Kálmán Balogh Gypsy Cimbalom Trio is the dynamic merging of music from the old and new worlds. Balogh continues a fabled European musical tradition harking back to the collaboration of masters like gypsy guitarist Django Reinhardt and violinist Stephane Grappelli, connecting ancient folk music traditions of Central and Eastern Europe with the chord progressions and swinging rhythm of jazz. Balogh's cimbalom becomes a new and compelling voice centering the Trio, which is enhanced by acoustic violin/viola and acoustic bass. Similarities in jazz and traditional folk music, such as improvisation and a kaleidoscope of emotional expressions, are immediately evident.
The Trio includes excellent musicians who have worked with Balogh extensively. Robert Lakatos, a viola and violin player from Slovakia, is steeped in classical music training and played with important classical orchestras, but always gravitated toward folk and world music. He plays in several groups ranging from classical to folk and jazz genres. Robert’s band, the RÉV, has become a popular band in Hungary and Slovakia. Bassist Csaba Novák is one of the most versatile bass players in Hungary, familiar with gypsy style, klezmer, folk music, jazz and world music.
Melodies polished in European villages for centuries are interpreted with great respect and understanding by trio, enabling present day music lovers to experience the emotions and beauty inherent in the music of our ancestors. Kálmán Balogh Cimbalom Trio brings a contemporary and uniquely forward-looking edge to time-honored traditions, leaving audiences enthralled and inspired.
261046917390452.name: Cimbalogh Trio Toronto concert

262611770575371.description:
Montreal writer Anna Leventhal launches her first book, Sweet Affliction, a collection of fifteen short stories that is by turns caustic, tender, and darkly funny. A short reading by the author will be followed by a conversation with Pasha Malla, author of People Park and The Withdrawal Method.

A pregnancy test is taken at a wedding, a bad diagnosis leads a patient to a surprising outlook, and a civic holiday becomes a dystopian nightmare. By turns caustic, tender, and creepily hilarious, Sweet Affliction reveals the frailties, perversions, and resilience of Anna Leventhal’s cast of city-dwellers. 

"Leventhal’s work grasps multiple and brazen connections between sisters, lovers, strangers, friends. These stories wander and please. They knife unexpectedly. Truth is lodged in all the cuts. These stories 'know the things energy can do.'"

Tamara Faith Berger, author of Maidenhead

"Sweet Affliction is — no big deal or anything — one of the most successful, high-functioning, sometimes perfect collections of short stories I’ve read in recent memory."

Andrew Hood, author of The Cloaca

"These stories stand Canadian literature on its head — amazing characters, totally original and unexpected situations, absolutely hilarious and heartfelt prose — Anna Leventhal is a one-of-a-kind talent."

Lee Henderson, author of The Man Game
262611770575371.name: Anna Leventhal launches Sweet Affliction in Toronto

266725900153340.description:
Dora Award-Winning Keystone Theatre proudly presents The Last Man on Earth – an original silent film style play about The Devil, love, innocence and pies. Directed by Ginette Mohr with music composition and live accompaniment by David Atkinson, this charming and bittersweet tale sees an evil villain and his minion plotting to corrupt the last vestige of innocence on earth. Underdog Gormless Joe must choose to play the hero or lose everything, including his one chance at love with Penelope the pie seller. 

The Last Man on Earth opens Thursday, April 3 and runs to April 13 (with a preview on April 2) at The Berkeley Street Theatre Upstairs. Tickets are $25 (ask about discount offers and PWYC performances) and are available by calling 416-368-3110 or by visiting www.canadianstage.com

Performed by:

Phil Rickaby, Dana Fradkin, Sarah Joy Bennett; Stephen LaFrenie & David Atkinson 

Creative Team:

Director: Ginette Mohr
Designer: Kimberly Beaune 
Lighting Designer: David Fox-Procenko 
Fight Director: Matt Richardson 
Music Director: David Atkinson 
Stage Manager: Kimberly Beaune 

Keystone Theatre creates, develops and presents new performances inspired by the silent film era. Reaching back to the earliest recorded work of the masters of the art of acting, Keystone Theatre reinvents performance styles that are universally accessible and visually profound. Using our unique physical vocabulary to create characters and develop narratives, Keystone Theatre explores performance styles in multiple media, including theatre, film and music, sometimes all at once.

www.keystonetheatre.net
266725900153340.name: The Last Man on Earth Comes to Toronto

269372993238354.description:
**Join us for the Toronto premiere of SILENCE IS GOLD, a film that explores the state of free-speech in a corporate dominated world. This screening is co-presented with the NFB - National Film Board of Canada, MiningInjustice Solidarity Network,  protestbarrick.net and Point of View Magazine. Sakura Saunders and guest speakers will be in attendance.

SILENCE IS GOLD
Julien Fréchette / Canada / 2012 / 77 ' / French / S.T. English

What are the limits to freedom of speech? Can we put a price on our spoken and written words? Following the 2008 release of the book Noir Canada, author Alain Deneault, his co-writers and his publisher, Éditions Écosociété, grappled with these questions – at great personal expense – after being sued for defamation in Quebec and Ontario courts by two large Canadian mining companies. Deneault and his publisher fought back, becoming entangled in a seemingly never-ending spiral of judicial proceedings. Silence Is Gold is a thriller of a documentary that tells their story, set against the backdrop of the Canadian justice system. We follow the complex procedural twists and turns, eagerly anticipating a resolution that is repeatedly delayed.

Filmmaker Julien Fréchette’s camera and questions lead us through this little- understood legal territory without judging or wading into the merits of the cases. His gaze is both subtle and attentive as he tactfully immerses himself in the story, initiating a dialogue with Alain Deneault, who becomes the protagonist of the film. Silence Is Gold raises crucial questions about Canada’s role and responsibilities in the global mining sector, the limits of free speech and equitable access to the Canadian justice system.

cinemapolitica.org/bloor
269372993238354.name: SILENCE IS GOLD - Toronto premiere with special guests

271493583000690.description:
LCI-D351 DC Lion Elias Jawish invites you to join the D351 delegation heading to the 97th Int' Lions Clubs International Convention in Toronto, Canada, from 4 to 18 th of July 2014.
A SPECIAL PROGRAM IS UNDER PREPARATION TO BE POSTED HERE SOON.
INFOS @ Lion Elias Jawish 03-360117.

Lions Clubs 97th LCICon in Toronto - July 4-8, 2014. http://lionsclubs.org/lcicon #LCICon

During convention week we encourage your to post your convention pictures, videos and stories on our wall! Hashtag #lcicon
General Information
LCI is making plans for an exciting 97th LCICon from July 4– 8, 2014 in the city of Toronto, Ontario, Canada, and we enthusiastically invite you to join the celebration.

Toronto, Canada’s most cosmopolitan city, is situated on beautiful Lake Ontario and is one of the most dynamic, culturally diverse and vibrant places on earth. Lions will find an abundance of vibrant nightlife, stunning architecture, great museums, wonderful vintage stores, luxury shops and everything in between. Discover and experience a world of arts, culture, and energy around every corner in a friendly atmosphere that welcomes everyone. Toronto is expecting you!

Convention-goers can look forward to an inspiring week of business and pleasure, as we unite to shape the future of our great association. The festivities include our own culturally diverse International Parade of Nations through the heart of Toronto along with interesting seminars, lively plenary sessions, the gala International Show, and the election of LCI's 2014-2015 International President.

The most important part of our international convention, however, is you – the Lions and Leos from around the world whose commitment to serving those in need remains constant in our ever-changing world. Join the fun July 4 – 8, 2014 in Toronto. We are expecting you!
271493583000690.name: LCI-D351 97TH INT' CONVENTION/TORONTO CANADA

279258322224876.description:
* Committed to social change and a better world?
* Interested in connecting with like-minded people in a deeper way?
* Need a pause from the daily grind to reflect and regroup?

... Come to the Jam!  

(Info & application here, due March 15! http://www.yesworld.org/torontojam/)

=========
*** What’s the Jam? ***
 
Think of when musicians get together to jam. They meet, experiment and play off of one another, and create beautiful new music. Now imagine instead of music, it was ideas and experiences being shared. Jams are open-ended and unscripted gatherings of 30 or so changemakers (ages ~18-40) who spend a week reflecting, sharing, building community, and creating new possibilities.
 
*** Why should I not miss this? ***
 
On a daily basis, many of us do too much and pause too little. Rarely do we get to step back and really check in with ourselves and with each other.
 
The Jam is an opportunity to have those authentic conversations we may not usually get to have: About the dreams that drive the work we do, the struggles that we move through, and the magic that keeps us going.
 
*** Is the Jam for you? ***
 
Do you have a relationship to social change (as an activist, artist, healer, parent, entrepreneur, community worker, or any other way)… Do you want to consciously evolve your work and your role? Then, Yes!
 
Do you have a relationship to community… Do you want to cultivate honesty, authenticity, vulnerability, openness to solving conflicts, and non-violence… Do you want to dream bigger or connect more across issues and communities? Then, Yes!
 
Do you have a relationship to yourself… Whether ‘good’ or ‘bad’ at self-care, do you struggle or feel ease with your relationship to yourself… Do you want to develop a kinder, truer connection to yourself? Then, Yes!
 
*** What happens at a Jam? ***
 
Take what you think you know about conferences, retreats, and symposiums and throw it out the window. Each Jam is unique, but you can expect a blend of facilitated dialogue, reflection, play and movement, artistic expression, deep inquiry, games, music, and meaning-making.
 
A Jam works on three different levels of change: the internal, the interpersonal, and the systemic.
 
On the internal level: we give ourselves space to reflect on our personal stories, learn and unlearn, take off our masks, seek our next growing edge, recharge, and renew.
 
On an interpersonal level, we come together to discover common grounds and celebrate differences. We take time for authentic conversations to bridge our divides (race, class, gender, etc), and take an honest, courageous, and loving look at our conflicts and relationships with one another.
 
On a systemic level, we link issues that aren’t commonly linked to find new intersection points and gain a clearer vision of the whole. We examine our work and role within the bigger picture, and deepen our capacity to affect meaningful change upon leaving the Jam.    

*** Who else comes to Jam? ***
Jams are for everyone.  The beauty of the jam lies in the mix of people who show up.

We look for a vibrant diversity in…
… experience (from 'just starting out' to 'been at it for years')
… roles (from 'person on the ground' to 'director and founder'; from 'entrepreneur' to 'non-profit' to 'healer' to 'philanthropist' to 'parent' to 'organizer' to 'urban farmer' – to so much more)
… passions and focus (education, immigration, technology, food security, health, arts, labour, green architecture, indigenous issues, community media, trauma recovery, globalization, etc. etc.)
… identities and worldviews (e.g. class, race, religion, sexuality, gender, age, dis/ability, ethnicity, etc.)
You can read more about past Jams and other Jams worldwide here.

*** Who’s behind the Toronto Jam 2014? ***

The Toronto Jam is organized and facilitated by a dynamic team of Toronto community changemakers (all YES! Jam Alumni): 
Lisa Thacker, Brigid Tierney, Karen B.K. Chan, Rehana Tejpar, Pauline Sok Yin Hwang, Adeline Cohen, nisha ahuja, plus Shilpa Jain from YES. 

*** How much will this cost? ***

We never want money to be a barrier in participating in a Jam, so we will do everything we can to make it work for you to attend.

Tuition for the Jam is $550, most of which covers food and lodging, and some of which covers program expenses. Some partial scholarships are available by request, and based on need. Payment plans (e.g. making a monthly payment over the year) can be arranged as well. Additional donations are welcome and tax deductible! They help us provide scholarships and ensure that the group is as diverse as possible. We ask people to consider a minimum contribution of $320 to cover hard costs of food and accommodation. We invite work trades as well. Participants are responsible for travel to the retreat center, though we can help arrange carpools. 

*** Can I bring my kid? ***

We can work with you to make arrangements for childcare. Please let us know if you have this need, so we can explore possibilities together.

*** Is the space wheelchair accessible? ***

The main floor of the retreat centre, including the common area, is wheelchair-accessible. Please contact us for details.

See http://www.yesworld.org/torontojam/ for more info and to apply. Deadline is March 15, 2014!
279258322224876.name: Toronto Jam 2014!

It's another great evening of music to raise money for a very special place! Disc4 (Sean, Dave, Rob, Kevin & Allan) and special guest Bridget Hunt are back for a second fundraising show for Gilda's Club Greater Toronto.  

Our 2012 event raised over $1500 and this year, we plan to top it! The silent auction will be bigger and better!

Tickets are $20 at the door (reserved), $25 without a reservation. Please note that ticket purchases are CASH ONLY.

Reserve your tickets directly with any of our hosts. Seating capacity this year is 80 -- so don't wait to reserve your spots!

Silent auction starts at 7pm, and the concert will start promptly at 8! 

The mission of Gilda’s Club is to provide a meeting place where men, women, teens and children living with cancer, as well as their families and friends, can join with others to build social and emotional support as a supplement to their treatment of choice. Gilda’s Club offers support and networking groups, lectures, workshops, and social events in a non-residential, home-like setting.

After its world premiere at the Cannes Film Festival last spring and subsequent screenings in Montreal, Boston, Fort Lauderdale and Sedona, the short film The Marvelous Girl makes its long-awaited debut in Toronto as part of the ReelWorld Film Festival.

"Beautiful and haunting." -- Glovebox Short Film and Animation Festival

Part narrative, part dance film, the fantasy drama tells the story of a young paraplegic girl who has an encounter with a "boy from her dreams". Their time together moves her in marvelous and unexpected ways. The film was executive produced by Bengt Jorgen (artistic director and former dancer with The National Ballet of Canada) and written and directed by Johnny Vong.

Watch a clip from the film: http://youtu.be/fXZu5Vc5lss?hd=1

The Super Bowl of spoken word is coming!

On Saturday April 19, come to the ROYAL CINEMA on College St. to see 8 talented spoken word poets battle it out to make the 2014 Toronto Poetry Slam Team!

The competing poets are:

Bassam  
Andre Prefontaine 
Sabrina 
MultiPurpose Hot Air Machine  
Estefania 
Prufrock 
Kara 
Ketch22 

The night begins with a very special opening act by the BAM! The (Toronto) Youth Slam Team!

Our guest feature for the evening is none other than JOSHUA BENNETT! 
Joshua Bennett hails from Yonkers, NY. He is a third-year doctoral candidate in the English Department at Princeton University, Callaloo Fellow, and, as of this summer, teacher of 8th grade Composition. His poetry has either been published or is forthcoming in  Callaloo, Anti-, Tidal Basin Review, Drunken Boat  , Storyscape and Muzzle. Joshua has recited his original work at venues such as The Sundance Film Festival, The NAACP Image Awards, and President Obama's Evening of Poetry and Music at The White House. He is also the founding editor of Kinfolks Quarterly. When he is not writing or editing or performing, Joshua enjoys watching Parks And Recreation on Netflix and practicing his free throws. He currently shoots about 62% from the line. He's working on it. 

Joshua will be making his Canadian debut! 

Hosted by Dave Silverberg 
7pm doors. 8pm show. General admission.
All ages
No open mic


Tickets are $15 in advance, $20 at the door

If you prefer to pay via online, we accept PayPal and e-transfer payment. If you do an e-transfer though, the cost is $16 per ticket due to bank fees for such transactions.

Email address for both options would be: info@torontopoetryslam.com

This is one spoken word show you DO NOT want to miss!

308850729266936.description:
Casting Director Matthew Morgan, CDC (As I Lay Dying, Blackbird, Big Significant Things, The Sound and the Fury) and Casting Director Michelle Grimaldi (Instant Cash, My House Your Money, Forbidden Science, Look-A-Like) of Morgan Casting are launching  a casting bootcamp multi-city tour across North America.  We are excited to kick off our Canadian leg in Toronto!   
 
May 3rd (Saturday) 2014   Toronto, ON   Bootcamp ADULTS 12:00pm-6:00pm (16 yrs & up) 

To purchase tickets: 
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/morgan-casting-bootcamp-toronto-tickets-11101050541?ref=estw

May 4th (Sunday)   2014   Toronto, ON   Bootcamp Kids       3:00pm-6:00pm   (6-15 years) 

To purchase tickets: 
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/morgan-casting-mini-bootcamp-for-kids-toronto-tickets-11105626227?ref=estw
 
Cost per Workshop: $150 for adults | Spaces are limited.
Cost per Workshop: $100 for kids*   | Spaces are limited.

*Note:   for the kids workshop ticket price covers one child and one guardian. 

Why is it called a Casting Bootcamp? Because these sessions will prepare you for the reality of the casting/auditioning world. We do not sugarcoat it.
Both sessions will cover Live Auditioning and Video Auditioning, as well as a variety of exercises and techniques including but not limited to improv work, on-camera scene work/auditioning techniques, slating, audition dos and don’ts...

Actors will be sent sides from which to choose one scene to prepare and upload a video audition to Breakdown Services prior to attending our bootcamp.  We also ask that you come with a 60-90 sec monologue of your choice prepared to perform at the workshop.  

Our special guest acting coach, Rikki G, from New Orleans, LA, will guide you through her unique techniques/acting exercises that will help you truly stand out at an audition and land the role you want.  

As video auditions are becoming increasingly the norm in our industry, Stephanie Allaire of Breakdown Services will be on site to guide actors through the process.  
We will wrap up the day with 15-30 minutes of Q&A.

This Casting Bootcamp will prepare actors for the realities of the auditioning process.


Light snacks and refreshments will be provided and covered in your ticket price.  
Price includes HST

Other upcoming cities:  Summer 2014 
Kingston, ON
Ottawa, ON
Montreal, QC
Shreveport, LA
New Orleans, LA
Houston, TX
Memphis, TN
Nashville, TN

'ARMIN ONLY: INTENSE' WORLD TOUR
*** TICKETS ***  On Sale Monday, October 28 @10:00 AM 
Early Bird General Admissions Tickets - $59.00 + taxes and service fees
Tier 1 General Admissions Tickets - $79.00 + taxes and service fees
Tier 2 General Admissions Tickets - $99.00 + taxes and service fees
VIP Tickets  - $149.00 + taxes and service fees 


*** THIS EVENT IS 19+ ONLY ***
--------------------------------------------------------------

October 17, 2013 (Los Angeles, CA) - Award-winning electronic music producer and global superstar DJ, Armin van Buuren, announced today North American dates for his brand new ARMIN ONLY: INTENSE world tour. The tour will kick off in North America on April 11 in New York City. Produced by Alda Events and promoted exclusively by Live Nation, the ARMIN ONLY: INTENSE tour will visit 8 cities in the U.S., Canada and Mexico including New York City, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Chicago, Toronto, Vancouver, Mexico City and Monterrey. 

One of dance music's biggest names, Armin van Buuren has been voted the world's #1 DJ by DJ Magazine an unprecedented five times and continues to play to sold-out audiences across multiple continents. Since 2001, he has hosted a radio show, A State Of Trance, that has amassed over 20 million weekly listeners in 26 countries.

The ARMIN ONLY: INTENSE world tour will support his latest full-length artist album, Intense, that saw its global release on May 3, 2013 and landed in the top 25 on the Billboard US Dance/Electronic Albums chart. For the creative vision behind the tour, Armin teamed up with famous theatre director Jos Thie and creative mind Sander Reneman (owner 250K). Together, the team has created a groundbreaking EDM experience using visually-arresting technical effects and stunning live performances that will leave fans breathless.
“The basis of Armin Only will always be a DJ set," says Armin. "But to make things more interesting, I’m going to try and really make the live moments almost like you would witness them in a theatre! I can't wait to bring this show to all the fans around the world.”
The world tour will launch with two sold-out shows in Armin's home city of Amsterdam on November 15 and 16 at the Ziggo Dome. After several dates across Russia, Armin will bring an epic 5-hour set featuring his signature musical style to North America starting in New York City and continuing through Monterrey, Mexico before moving on to dates in Australia, South Africa and Russia to close out the 20-date world tour. Even more international dates will be announced soon. A list of North American dates is below.

*Vancouver, BC, Mexico City, MX and Monterrey, MX general public on sale date and time is TBD

389756164500899.description:
Let's raise a glass to the University of Ontario Institute of Technology (UOIT) experience!

Please join your fellow alumni and members of your UOIT Alumni Association Council for Pub Night. We'd love to hear what you're up to and to tell you about the exciting developments and events happening at UOIT this year.

Join us for one, two or all of these fun events. Reconnect with old friends. Make some new ones. Appetizers and a drink are on us. If you RSVP now, you'll even have a chance to win some terrific prizes. Looking forward to seeing you!

Your UOIT Alumni Association Council 

Oshawa
Thursday, April 17
6:30 p.m.
Riley’s Olde Towne Pub 
104 King Street East, Oshawa, Ontario 
*RSVP by Friday, April 11, 2014

Calgary
Thursday, May 8
5 p.m.
Location to be confirmed
*RSVP by Friday, May 2, 2014

Toronto
Thursday, May 8
6:30 p.m.
The 3 Brewers
275 Yonge Street, Toronto, Ontario
*RSVP by Friday, May 2

*RSVP to alumni@uoit.ca and include the locations of the receptions you plan to attend.

Please remember to bring your UOIT alumni ID card to the event – this entitles you to entry and a complimentary drink ticket. If you don’t have an ID card, submit a request through the Alumni card request form (www.uoit.ca/alumni). 

Guests are welcome to attend and enjoy the appetizers for only $5 at the door.

FORWARD EVER .. BACKWARD NEVER

"You can kill a revolutionary but you can never kill the revolution." Fred Hampton

Grenadians at home, Brooklyn, London, Washington D.C. and elsewhere, are all having their own unique celebrations to mark this unforgettable era in their nation's history. 

In Toronto the celebration takes place on Sat., March 22, 2014 at the Grenada Sports & Cultural club located at 523 Rogers Road in Toronto, Ontario.

An Edutaining event where by the Grenadian Revolution legacy is told through positive interactions with each other via photo's, music video presentation & or dance.

Admission $10

Doors open at 10 p.m.

Sound by Kitron Eazysound Int  & Kamu Jtsoundz

415322605269762.description:
We have a new studio space opening up in the lovely Leslieville Area.  The space is a creative hotspot for collaboration and building of ideas and expression.  There is a whole new menu of art projects for individuals and groups to do workshops.  You can come in to decide on the style of painting, the size of canvas and get the materials and the guidance to make your artistic vision come to life.

The party on the 12th will be a celebration of the new studio space.  We will have an entire day of different art happenings to check out throughout the Saturday, with a generalized schedule as follows:

2-4pm KIDS - Collage and paper designs where kids of all ages can come and make their own work that we will be hanging that afternoon.
5-8pm Live Painting and Live Music Collaborations
8:30-11pm Gallery and Lounge Style DJ Dance Party

Artwork will be gracing the walls of the studio, all for sale, with giveaways and specials all day.  There will be a few bits and bites available and some bevvys to wet your whistle.  
Bring your friends and colleagues and celebrate the new space! 


I hope you can make it and can't wait to show it off!

We've planned the most exciting and fun Bachata & Kizomba congress to ever happen in Canada. With amazing social dancing, eye catching shows and performances. 'Brundibar', Opera for Children
featuring St Paschal Baylon Choir/ Toronto Concert Orchestra

Doors at 7:00pm, performance at 7:30pm

Tickets: $20 (available at http://www.ticketweb.ca/t3/sale/SaleEventDetail?dispatch=loadSelectionData&eventId=4148714)

More information: http://brundibar.artspolonia.com/

'Brundibar' is an anti-bullying story by Hans Krasa. Imprisoned by the Nazis at Terezin Camp he produced this uplifting story with children inmates and gave multiple performances. The music is delightful and your family will enjoy the positive message it conveys. The cast is entirely young people with an ensemble from the Toronto Concert Orchestra (www.torontoconcertorchestra.com) conducted by Kerry Stratton.

The stage direction is by the widely experienced Lesley Ballantyne. As a preamble to the opera, you will enjoy the prize winning St. Pascal Baylon Choir, directed by Daniele Colla.  

Profits from this production go to the Toronto Concert Orchestra's education programme.

432463520207650.description:
(version française après le texte anglais)

Hi Everyone,

There has been a complicated and unplanned situation involving Kinetik Production that as of this week has become insurmountable. Unfortunately because of the confidential nature of the case, it’s impossible to go into details, but you need to know that we are now facing issues that have a major effect on the continuation of the Kinetik Festival. After consulting council and looking at all possible options, we sadly have to close down Kinetik Productions and put an end to the Kinetik Festival.

For everyone that knows me more personally, you know that the Kinetik Festival has been my ‘’life’’ for more than 8 years and it is with no small consideration or regret that I put an end to this project. But with the threat of the ongoing issue, it was now more than possible that the 7.0 couldn't happen next May. We are aware of the effect this could have on people traveling to the festival and on all the fans that will not be able to see the bands that were booked for Kinetik 7.0, but we want to ensure that we are capable of issuing refunds on all the online tickets purchases, so our only option was canceling Kinetik now. We are not a ''big'' productions company like in mainstream music; being a non profit company, the one and only event that we produce is the Kinetik Festival, and tickets sales have always been the only source of income. We hope you will understand that this was the best and only way to get out of this terrible situation, while still being able to refund everyone in the shortest period possible.

This ongoing situation has nothing to do with the Toronto venue and or with the Kinetik Festival partners that have shown nothing but full support for the festival. We are also presently working with some partners in Toronto so some of the shows (the ones that were part of tours) still happen and that Toronto fans still have a chance  to see those excellent bands. We will post more about this as soon we have more information about it.

Refunds will start today, going backward month by month, since paypal offers full refunds on the newest transactions. When we are at the transactions not covered by the paypal full refund, we will contact you so you can confirm that we can issue refunds on the original transaction via your original transaction record. We will post updates here on the Facebook page to inform you where we are up to with the refunds. Be sure to look in your inbox for an email from  ''sales@festival-kinetik.net'' to be sure to receive your refund.

Once again, this is really not our hope for how the 7.0 edition would turn out, and we hope that you will understand that this action is a last recourse after considering many options.

-----------------------------

Bonjour à tous,

Suite à un évènement imprévus et d'une complexité énorme touchant Kinetik Productions qui a pris des tournures insurmontables cette semaine nous nous voyons maintenant obliger de prendre une décision drastique. Sans rentrer dans les détails due à la nature confidentielle de l'évènement,  nous faisons maintenant face à une grave situation qui met en péril la continuité du Festival Kinetik. Après avoir consulté différents experts et regardé les différentes options que nous avions, nous avons dus prendre la difficile décision de mettre un terme à l'aventure Kinetik Productions et donc mettre en arrêt dès maintenant le Festival Kinetik 2014.

Pour ceux qui me connaissent personnellement vous savez que le Festival Kinetik à été une grande part de ma ''vie'' pour les huit dernières années et ce n'est pas sans regret et sans avoir regarder toutes les options avant de prendre cette difficile décision. Mais avec toutes les répercutions actuelles et la confirmation que le festival ne pourrait avoir lieu sans répercutions majeure nous avions pas d'autre choix que d'annuler l'édition 2014 du festival. Nous sommes au courant de l'impact sur les visiteurs venant de loin pour le festival et pour tous les fans qui ne pourrons pas voir leurs groupes préférés, mais nous voulons avant tout nous assurer que nous sommes en position de pouvoir rembourser l'achat des billets du festival. N'étant pas une grosse boîte de productions de musique commercial, notre organisme à but non lucratif n'a que pour seul revenu la vente de billets du festival annuel. Nous espérons que vous comprendrez que ceci étais le seul moyens de nous sortir de la situation présente tout en assurant un remboursement dans les plus bref délais pour les visiteurs.

La situation qui a poussé à cette annulation n'a rien à voir avec la salle de spectacle de Toronto, les partenaires ou groupes de musiques qui depuis le début démontre un support complet envers le festival. Nous sommes aussi actuellement en train de travailler avec des personnes ressources de Toronto pour voir les options pour que certains spectacles qui faisaient parti des tournées puissent quand même avoir lieux. Plus d'informations sera publiée dès que des mises à jour seront disponibles.

Les remboursements d'achats de billets commencerons aujourd'hui, en ordre décroissant (à partir des ventes de ce week end) comme Paypal offre un remboursement direct pour les achats les plus récents. Une fois rendu aux transactions non couvertes par ce remboursement direct, nous allons vous contacter à l'adresse courriel utilisé originalement pour faire l'achat de vos billets. Nous allons publier des mises à jour sur le groupe Facebook et la page web du festival pour vous tenir au courant des périodes d'achats ou nous allons en être pour les remboursements. Assurez-vous de rapidement répondre lorsque vous recevrez un courriel de  ''sales@festival-kinetik.net'' et qu'il n'arrive pas dans vos courriel indésirables pour assurer un remboursement rapide.

Encore une fois, ceci n'est vraiment pas comme nous l'avions envisagé l'édition 7.0 du festival et nous espérons que vous comprendrez que ceci étais malheureusement notre unique et dernière option après avoir étudié tous les options qui auraient pu éviter une pareille annulation.
432463520207650.name: Kinetik Festival 7.0 - Toronto Edition - CANCELED

432486140218253.description:
Guest Speaker: Kim Inglis – Adding a global lens to your investment portfolio

KIM INGLIS, BCOM, CIM, PFP, FCSI, AIFP
Investment Advisor & Portfolio Manager
Kim Inglis is an Investment Advisor & Portfolio Manager.  She is a founding partner of the Reynolds Inglis Group, an independent financial advisory group within Canaccord Genuity Wealth Management.  Kim manages the discretionary investment portfolios of high and ultra-high net worth clients.

Kim is also a nationally syndicated financial columnist and frequent speaker at business events.  She is a contributing columnist for the Financial Post.  Kim is also the regular columnist for Business In Vancouver and several community newspapers across Canada.  Her work has been featured in most of the country's major newspapers.

Investors generally understand diversification but many fail to diversify globally. They could learn from institutional investors, who have large holdings in worldwide markets. Kim will show how global investing helps in areas like risk management and portfolio yield.  She will also provide some actionable ideas and be available for Q&A.

448021138634486.description:
Join the Toronto Anarchist Black Cross for our monthly night of conversation and letter writing. 

This month we'll be writing to local prisoners including wrongfully convicted anarchist prisoner Nyki Kish, and recently sentenced American G20 prisoners Richard Morano, Kevin Chianella, and Joel Bitar. We will also be writing to Rebecca Rubin - who was extradited from Canada and recently sentenced to 5 years for Earth Liberation Front-related charges. 

Accessibility: This child-friendly event is FREE and a vegan meal will be provided. Beit Zatoun is two steps from street level and washrooms are located in the basement. A mobile ramp is available for the entrance stairs. 

Next month, join us  to write to Palestinian prisoners (date TBC). 

Thanks as always to Beit Zatoun for their generous support in letting us host letter nights in their space!

For details on these cases: 
http://freenyki.org
http://notorontog20extradition.wordpress.com
http://supportjoel.com
http://www.greenisthenewred.com/blog/rebecca-rubin-elf-sentenced/7576

POUZZA FEST (www.pouzzafest.com) and 
MLAunderground (www.facebook.com/mlaunderground)
with the help of some great promoters, friends, venues, and bands are happy to bring to Ontario for the first time:
                          
BRUTAL CHERIE(MONTREAL PUNK ROCK, L'ECURIE RECORDS)
https://brutalcherie.bandcamp.com/
https://fr-ca.facebook.com/.../Brutal-Chérie/21312690
http://youtu.be/-jPUYWD44Tw


BRUTAL CHERIE have been playing tons of shows since 2010 in Quebec and also touring Europe.  They've played festivals like POUZZA FEST, AMNESIA  ROCKFEST, and have played shows with such bands as DIRECT HIT!, MASKED INTRUDER, SNUFF, STRUNG OUT, THE FLATLINERS, and too many more to name. 
They released their album "Cour ou Creve" (Run or Die) in 2012 and it earned them the GAMIQ award in 2013 for best independent punk album of the year in Quebec, and considering the insane amount of amazing punk bands in Quebec that's pretty impressive.  They'll be back at POUZZA FEST 4 in MONTREAL MAY 16-18 and continue to win new fans wherever they play, so come check them on these Ontario dates:

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
POUZZA FEST www.pouzzafest.com/ happens May 16-18 2014 in downtown Montreal and is one of the coolest fests around for punk rock fans. The fest takes over multiple venues in downtown Montreal and the 4th edition features some incredible bands.  DILLINGER FOUR, CHIXDIGGIT, MAD CADDIES, SNFU, DAYGLO ABORTIONS, REAGAN YOUTH, 7 SECONDS, CJ RAMONE, THE MENZINGERS, THE FLATLINERS, THE BRAINS, MUSTARD PLUG, THE HOLY MESS, and too many more to mention here. So check out the website for all the bands, the schedules, and book a hotel because it's going to be good.

MLAunderground Productions puts on punk shows in Oshawa and Peterborough and also in other places too. The goal is always to book bands I like and do what I can to get people to hear them and to try to quietly crusade against mainstream crap and promote the underground.  If you like going to shows and are in these areas or passing through you should see what we've got going on. 466754270091154.description:
Don't miss the epic MORE PLEASE! album release show of 'The Bounty' at Hugh's Room  in Toronto on May 28th featuring Scotty Mack on guitar and lead vocals,  David Pepe Celia  on guitar, Ian MacKay on drums and Chris Christopher A. Norman on bass.

Contact Hugh's Room during regular business hours @ 416 531-6604 or email info@hughsroom.com to buy advance tickets for the show ($15 adv / $18 doors).  Doors are at 6pm for anyone coming for dinner or wanting a preferred seat. This one might sell out so make sure you book ahead!

MORE PLEASE!

***www.morepleasemusic.ca 

More Please Just named one of top 10 anglo Canadian bands to watch for in 2014

***http://quebec.huffingtonpost.ca/2014/02/10/artistes-anglophones-canadiens-a-surveiller_n_4760385.html

Scotty Mack, the creative inspiration behind the band More Please!, splits his time between guiding trips in the wilderness and playing music in cities. More Please! songs evoke the tension of a polarized Canadian experience, transporting you from gritty city life, through rolling countryside to the woods, and back again.
More Please! has evolved into a shared adventure amongst friends. Chris Norman, Nathan Doucet (Crosss, Mike O’Neil) and Ian MacKay (Basia Bulat) first joined Scotty to create the band. 

After producer and touring artist David Pepe Celia recorded a demo of the band in his 1970’s Mississauga bungalow, he joined More Please! and produced a full-length record at his home studio Organica and at Andy Magoffin's House of Miracles. The culmination of this effort is the debut More Please! album The Bounty, to be released in the spring of 2014. The diversity of the rhythms, the inspired arrangements, the balance between psychedelic folk, progressive rock and indie pop will take you on a sonic journey. 

More Please! has found inspiration by collaborating live and in the studio with a wide range of musicians: Warren Spicer and Mathew Woodley (Plants and Animals), Joe Grass (Patrick Watson), Josh Toal (Katie Moore), Dani Daniel Oore (Gypsophelia), Bob Wiseman (Blue Rodeo), Leanne Zacharias (Christine Fellows, Hylozoists), Sarah Page (Barr Brothers), Bryden Baird (Fiest), Rebekah Higgs, Jeff Louch, Brooke Gray Harris and Terra Lightfoot among others.

The More Please! adventure does not end with the album; witnessing a live performance will let you experience their musical landscape first-hand.
466754270091154.name: MORE PLEASE! Album Release show THE BOUNTY // Hugh's Room, Toronto

Canadian University Press is in trouble. We hope to help. CUP has run into dire financial straits and is raising funds to stay afloat. We're CUP alumni who want to lend a hand to the organization that fuelled our passion for journalism, introduced us to countless peers and mentors, and launched our careers in the business.

On March 18, you can help. Head over to Handlebar in Kensington Market. Buy a pint. See some old friends. Meet some new friends. And, finally, donate what you can to Keep CUP Strong. It'll be just like your favourite night out at NASH, but without the awful hangover the next morning (or not; that's up to you). And you're helping CUP do what it does best: pump out Canada's next generation of journalists.

Please spread the word. Let's pack this place.

UPDATE: Attend the fundraiser and you'll witness our killer silent auction. More details soon.

Keep CUP Strong: http://www.indiegogo.com/projects/keep-cup-strong

488211777957055.description:
"An exciting and provocative play, an unforgettable evening of drama." —NY Post.

"Stirring moments of impassioned rhetoric you feel as if you've watched a kind of human-scale wrestling with angels." —San Francisco Examiner.

"A remarkable, intensely intimate meeting full of undisguised competitiveness, deep passion and potent reasoning THE MEETING is enthralling." —Chicago Sun Times.

Fascinating and dramatically compelling, this eloquent play depicts a secret meeting of two of the most important men of modern times: Malcolm X and Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. Differing in their philosophies, but alike in their mutual respect, the two men debate their varying approaches to the same grave social problems, both prepared to die for their beliefs but neither aware of how soon their assassins' bullets would await them.

THE STORY

The action takes place in a suite high up in a Harlem hotel, where Malcolm X and his bodyguard, Rashad, rest before Malcolm's fateful appearance at the Audubon Ballroom. Malcolm has requested a secret meeting with Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr., who is also in New York, and Dr. King has responded by trudging up the back stairs to Malcolm's suite.

Cautious at first, the two quickly fall into a spirited debate about their differing approaches to improving the lot of the black man in a predominantly white society—Dr. King (the lamb) hoping to find racial harmony through love and peaceful resistance, while Malcolm (the lion) is reconciled to violence and revenge if blacks are to win out over oppression. But no matter how provocative and persuasive his arguments, Malcolm is unable to shake Dr. King's commitment and composure—even when he defeats him in a bout of arm wrestling. As it happens, Malcolm's Chicago home had been fire bombed that morning and, as he prepares to leave, Dr. King gives him a present: a much loved doll that his daughter had asked him to give to the Malcolm's. The two men then arm wrestle again, this time to a draw, an act symbolic not only of their clash of wills but also of the conflicting beliefs which both honor in the other but will not accept for themselves, no matter how eloquent and powerful the arguments set forth.

WORLD APPEAL & ACCOLADES:

The Meeting is intelligent theatre; and has toured to all fifty states and more than a dozen countries including South Africa, the Netherlands, The Virgin Islands, Nigeria, Scotland, United Kingdom, Brazil, Jordan and Austria. 

Profile Entertainment takes pride in bringing this culturally significant event to Toronto’s myriad audiences.

ACCOLADES:
•
8 NAACP IMAGE AWARDS including Best Play and Best Playwright
•
6 New York Audelco Nominations
•
A Louis B. Mayer Award for Excellence
•
An Ohio State Achievement Award
•
An Emmy Award for the adapted version for PBS and American Playhouse

The Meeting will play for Toronto audiences on 

Friday  April 11th and Saturday April 12th, 2014, at the Queen Elizabeth Theatre; 190 Princes Blvd on CNE Grounds.

REGULAR TICKETS

GROUP SALES

GROUPS OF 10 OR MORE RECEIVE A 10% DISCOUNT

The Profile Entertainment team is available and ready to handle your discounted group tickets purchase. Whether your group is as small as 10 or as large as 1000, our expertly trained staff will handle your group order with exceptional courtesy and proficiency to ensure our customers have a great experience from beginning to end. From discussing group pricing, to payment options, to final purchase, we make the process streamlined, efficient, and hassle free so you can enjoy the finest live urban theatre productions here in Toronto.

Booking a group is real easy to do. Simply invite the people you already know and socialize with. Get a final number confirmed and give us a call. It’s that easy. A group can be a church organization; a group of colleagues or department from work; a sports team; students at your school; a club you belong to; family and friends; or any combination thereof.
You may take advantage of group discounts by utilizing contacts you already have. Group discounts starts with a minimum of 10 people and offers a 10% discount for up to 19 people. Groups of 20 or more please call for a quotation.

504351289671118.description:
Join us for the 2014 Gala Signal Editions Launch for April poetry month, featuring:

Birds Flock Fish School by Edward Carson
Satisfying Clicking Sound by Jason Guriel
Dante’s House by Richard Greene
Dog Ear by Jim Johnstone

The evening will be hosted by Michael Lista, author of the collection of poetry, Bloom. He is the poetry editor of the Walrus and a poetry columnist at the National Post.

About the poets:

Edward Carson is the author of two previous books of poetry, Scenes [1977] and Taking Shape [2008]. Twice winner of the E.J. Pratt Poetry Award, Carson was Writer in Residence for Open Book Toronto in In 2010. He lives in Toronto.

Jason Guriel’s books include The Pigheaded Soul: Essays and Reviews on Poetry and Culture (2013) and Pure Product (2009). His work has been anthologized in The Best Canadian Poetry in English. In 2007, he became the first Canadian to be awarded Poetry’s Frederick Bock Prize. Poetry gave him their Editors Prize for Book Reviewing in 2009. He lives in Toronto.

Richard Greene teaches Creative Writing and British Literature at the University of Toronto. His most recent biography Edith Sitwell: Avant-garde Poet, English Genius [2011] was widely acclaimed, and he has published three collections of poetry, including Boxing the Compass [2010], which won the Governer General's Award for Poetry. He lives in Cobourg, Ontario.

Jim Johnstone is the author of three previous books of poetry: The Velocity of Escape (2008), Patternicity (2010) and Sunday, the locusts (2011). He is the recipient of a CBC Literary Award, The Fiddlehead’s Ralph Gustafson Poetry Prize, and Matrix Magazine’s LitPop Award. Currently he’s the Poetry Editor at Palimpsest Press, and an Associate Editor at Representative Poetry Online. He lives in Toronto.
504351289671118.name: 2014 Gala Signal Editions Launch in Toronto

504993699609925.description:
Join TouchWood Editions and friends in celebrating the release of

A FAMILY BY ANY OTHER NAME: EXPLORING QUEER RELATIONSHIPS
Edited by Bruce Gillespie

Tuesday, April 8
6:30pm
Ben McNally Books 
366 Bay Street
Toronto

With readings by Kate Barker. S. Bear Bergman, 'Nathan Burgoine, Jason Dale, Dorianne Emmerton, Bruce Gillespie, Max Mosher, Maya Saibil and Keph Senett.

At no other time in history have lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender (LGBT) relationships and families been more visible or numerous. A FAMILY BY ANY OTHER NAME recognizes and celebrates this advance by exploring what family means to people today. The anthology includes a wide range of perspectives on queer relationships and families, as well as essays by straight writers about having a gay parent or child. These personal essays are by turns funny, provocative, and intelligent, but all are moving and honest. 

The fifth book in a series of books about the twenty-first-century family, "A Family by Any Other Name" follows "How to Expect What You’re Not Expecting," "Somebody’s Child," "Nobody’s Mother," and "Nobody’s Father," all essay collections that challenge readers to re-examine traditional definitions of family.

More about the book here: http://bit.ly/1msxBNo

For more information about this event, please call Ben McNally Books at (416) 366-8973 or email info@touchwoodeditions.com.

www.touchwoodeditions.com
504993699609925.location: Ben McNally Books, 366 Bay Street, Toronto

Berlin based DJ, producer and label owner Len Faki is one of the most outstanding and in-demand artists in techno's present age. He is an internationally requested dj, whose productions and remixes are played by techno’s most prominent names. Being a resident at Berlin’s prime techno club Berghain since its opening in 2004 keeps him open-minded as both, dj and producer. His sound is constantly evolving without ever losing its vibrant, unique energy and the passion and heart he puts into his sets. His gigs are an audio-visual adventure where he is not only playing for the crowd but rather performing for and with them.

Even before his move to Berlin in 2003, Len Faki had the experience of managing two highly acclaimed techno labels, Monoid and Feis. These early years of fruitful productivity provided the necessary groundwork for the next big steps in his career. Upon his arrival in Berlin, it didn´t take long until he became a resident-DJ in the newly opened Berghain - a match made in techno heaven and a monthly experience he wouldn´t want to miss for anything. The characteristic extra long DJ-sets in his "living room" inspire him to vary in tone and fully roll out his style to explore and further deepen his mastery of turning a DJ-set into a bona fide musical journey.
515177241923935.name: LEN FAKI @ WRONGBAR | Toronto | April 5, 2014

519405108170500.description:
Toronto Ravel is a score study group led by John Herberman. April's study features special guests: Asher Ettinger, Dr Lee Bartel, and Ron Jones (via skype from LA)!

How do we ‘hear’ music?  How does music convey emotion and how does the brain process musical emotion? What are some of the neural pathways that we do know about that relate to the perception of music?  How is hearing music different from imagining music? The answer will definitely surprise you! “Music and The Brain”... 

APRIL SPECIAL GUESTS:
- Asher Ettinger is a composer and artist, and partner in Think Music. His fascination with music and the brain has led him to read and study much of the current literature, and he will share some of his favourite topics with us. Asher is also a synesthete – someone who hears music in colours. 
- Dr. Lee Bartel is a researcher at the U of T Faculty of Music with a specialty in music and healing in the brain.  
- Ron Jones, originator of the ‘Ravel’ idea, is a composer in L.A., and currently scores “Family Guy” – with a pencil! 

9:30 A.M. – coffee and time to say hello to friends (please plan to arrive by 9:50)
10:00 – 11:00 – score study
11:00 – 12:00 – guest speaker
12:00 noon – light lunch is served, with plenty of time to mingle and converse with our guest

The cost is $22.50 by reservation ($25 at the door) which covers lunch. To reserve, please call Hugh’s Room directly at 416 531-6604, between 12:00 and 7:00 P.M. daily. 

For more information visit www.torontoravel.com

Toronto Ravel isn't just a score study. We are reminded that we are part of an ensemble; the larger collaboration of creators that enhances what we do: musicians, composers, directors, editors... All are welcome! 

See you at Ravel!
519405108170500.name: "Music and The Brain" Toronto Ravel - Tuesday April 15th

519473784840132.description:
Krip-Hop Nation founder, Leroy Moore along with Tangled Art + Disability kick off Canada’s first Krip-Hop event featuring Leroy Moore and Rob Da’ Noize Temple. Headlining the show will be Cleveland Heights’ alternative hip-hop duo Deacon Burns and Kaya Rogue, known to the music industry as KOUNTERCLOCKWISE.  Local Toronto hip-hop artist Rakiem Smith will be making his Toronto debut for this show. 

Krip-Hop Nation:

Krip-Hop Nation is a global movement of hip-hop artists with disabilities, founded by Leroy Moore. Since its inception, the movement has spread across the United States and beyond – from South Africa to New Zealand to Palestine. Krip-Hop is a community as well as style of music, an artistic space where youth with disabilities can speak out and speak back to the social structures that exclude people based on disability, race, sexuality, and a host of other marginalized identities. Krip-Hop Nation also strives to bring the talents of hip-hop artists with disabilities to the attention of a wider public, including media, educators, scholars, and journalists; and has developed a strong global online community to promote and disseminate the work of hip-hop by artists with disabilities.

About the artists:

Leroy F. Moore Jr.:

Your host Leroy F. Moore Jr. is a Black writer, poet, hip-hop/music lover, community activist and feminist with a physical disability. Leroy is Co-founder and Community Relations Director of the Sins Invalid performance project, and is the creator of Krip-Hop Nation.  He is currently writing a Krip-Hop book.

Rob Da’ Noize Temple is a music producer, songwriter, artists and keyboardist, and has been in the music industry for over 40 years. He has been playing keyboards since he was six years old and although he has Erbs Palsy, having just the use of one hand, he has never stopped trying to achieve his dreams.  As part of the group Conway & Temple, Rob was the first artist signed to Jive Records back in 1986 with the labels first single, “Love Lights / You Can Lay Your Head On my Shoulder” becoming a European hit.  He has continued producing music since 1980 as well as performing in live bands. Rob is currently music director, keyboardist and back-up DJ for the pioneers of Hip Hop, Rapper’s Delight featuring Wonder Mike & Master Gee  and  has just completed music production on their newly released documentary, “I Want My Name Back”.

Kounterclockwise:

Deacon Burns (MC, Producer, Songwriter, Musician & Engineer)

In 2007, as the group was courted by several indie & major labels; fate took a wrong turn when Deacon had a tragic accident – breaking 5 vertebrae, several ribs, collapsed both lungs and had a hairline neck fracture. He suffered a severe spinal cord injury that resulted in paralysis of both legs. As a true entertainer, Deacon decided that the show must go on no matter what. He spent his entire recovery time writing songs, accumulating an impressive catalogue of over 150. Deacon is a music aficionado whose influences vary from Nine Inch Nails to Ol’ Dirty Bastard. He plays multiple instruments (guitar, bass, ASR10 and a MPC 2000XL), is a gifted producer & songwriter, and even directs & edits videos.

Kaya Rogue (Co-Producer, Co-Writer, Engineer, Singer & Musician)

New York City’s Kaya Rogue also plays multiple instruments (guitar, bass, and keyboards), is a singer and assists Deacon in both music and video production. An entertaining part of the group’s live show is when the audience dresses up as different characters. Their concerts have been labeled as “visual art”. It’s been a long time coming for Kounterclockwise to release their debut album, “Daylight Savings Time.”

For more information, visit: http://www.kounterclockwise.com/

Rakiem Smith:

Bio coming soon.

526188910831198.description:
Join us on March 25th for AB107 at The Great Hall in Toronto!

Last month's all-star celebration was a truly amazing night of creation and community. This month Art Battle Toronto welcomes 16 new-star painters to the easels. We can't wait to share their talent and courage with you!

Featured Artists:

Rosalind Breen
Daniel St Amant
Danilo Ursini
Natasha Dichpan
Rija Ahsan
Colin Davis
Danny Smith
Svetlana Iouchkova
Christine Purdy
Leo Buendia Baduria
Al Konstantinou
Natasha Kudashkina
Spencer aka RANDOM
Han Sol Kim
Susan Qu

Now in more than a dozen cities from coast-to-coast, Art Battle Canada is searching for the best painters from across the country and Toronto is the city that started it all! You decide who wins the title, $200 cash prize and a chance to advance to challenge Vancouver's Yared Nigussu for the National Championship.

On May 10th the whole country will be painting together as we celebrate the first ever Art Battle Day. For more information and our call for local organizers, please visit http://artbattle.ca/abd, inquiries can be made by email to hello@artbattle.ca

Visit us at http://artbattle.com/ for info on all our events and follow on twitter @artbattlecanada

To compete as a painter at Art Battle in Toronto or another city, please visit our application page http://artbattle.ca/register

What is Art Battle?
Art Battle is a live competitive painting event. 16 painters will create the best work they can in 20 minutes. As they work, the audience moves around the easels, allowing them an up close view of the creative process. The medium used is acrylic paint and the tools allowed are brushes, palette knives or any other non-mechanical implements. At the end of the round, the audience votes for their favourite painting and can also later place bids in a silent auction to take the paintings home. This is Art Battle Canada's 5th season!

Art Battle 107
Tuesday, March 25, 2014
The Great Hall, 1087 Queen St W, 7:30pm

Tickets available online and at the door
$20, 15$ limited advance
12-Month Membership passes also available.

Email hello@artbattle.ca with any questions :)

See you on the 25th!
xo
Art Battle
